;;;HelpForReturnKey (d-InfoDialog (_ "The Return keypress can be used as a special instantly movable shortcut,
you can set it to any menu action you wish by pressing it while you have the item selected
Any one-key shortcut can be set this way, but with Return you do not get told if you are taking the shortcut away from another command.
Also the setting is not saved.
The idea is to set it for your current activity (e.g. applying tenuto marks).
You can make it "normal" by setting a preference - see Edit->Preferences->Command Behavior.
Note that the Enter key on the numeric keypad is a separate key (or should be!) and can be used as a shortcut independently"))
row._tooltip: Does nothing except explain what the Return key is used for in Denemo, and how to make it an ordinary shortcut if you prefer.
